review: Stopped by for dinner at around 8, it was busy as we expected but we were seated immediately. The food took awhile but it was expected. The service was really good Out waiter was nice and attentive.  I had the Quesadilla Explosion Salad, ehhh lacked flavor but it was very filling.  I was very disappointed on our drinks, we both ordered one of their summer drinks, the watermelon cooler. It was sweet and refreshing BUT it had no alcohol, basically agua de sandia (watermelon water). Next time I'll stick to the regular drink menu.

This location is real hit or miss. I've gone sometimes and it has been fantastic. Other times, it has horrible service and I can't even find a hostess to seat me.  Some days it is a 5 star, but others a 1 star. For the inconsistency, I'm giving it 2 stars as I only go here when everywhere else is closed.

Ordered online for pick up. If you order via the app it will always shows it is not available for this location. It's 7:32pm on a Friday so I understand they are busy on the pick up side but there should be no reason why I have not been acknowledged while standing in the pick up section for at least 20 minutes. Once someone finally greeted me the order wasn't even ready and had to wait another 20 minutes. This is ridiculous!  Update: To top it off my order was missing items and was completely wrong.

Carry out: We got chickens tenders cut up into small pieces in place of our fried pickles. I'm not sure why they couldn't just tell me they were out of pickles and take it off my bill. I guess they were trying to fool us and hope we wouldn't notice the pickles tasted like chicken. Also one of our sides was supposed to be mashed potatoes but we just got a bunch of fries....Ticket number 980087, 1/4/2018 6:50pm
My favorite neighborhood bar in Houston! Beer is always cold and food comes out fast. Ample parking too.
The food here is always perfect. I order the chipotle steak and shrimp with asparagus. I love their lemonades and Arnold Palmer. It is a bit noisy, but most Chili's restaurants are.

Yeah, this place is pretty horrible. All I wanted was dessert, so I ordered the skillet chocolate chip cookie. The wait wasn't that long, but by reading reviews you can tell service and waiting is an issue, so maybe that's why they are so pressed to get everything out quickly.  My first cookie was raw, so I returned it and patiently waited for another.  The second, same thing. The bartender tried to make it right by offering something else, but NAH, I'm good. I left.  I didn't know baking cookies were so difficult.

OK, so it was my "diet cheat day" and I thought I'd visit the Chili's in my neighborhood. Short version: It's your typical Chili's, but between the lazy bartender and the equally lazy waitstaff, I'll avoid this place in the future. Long version: It's Chili's. It's a chain. The food is the same everywhere. We get that. However, THIS location leaves a LOT to be desired. Let's start with the bartender. As Yelpers know about me, I (a) always sit at the bar if I'm by myself and (b) give the waitstaff 5 minutes to either acknowledge me or give me a menu before I leave.  This location almost got the "Peter Hughes Exit" penalty. I waited for almost 5 minutes before the bartender even showed up - and he was about to address a man who came in just 30 seconds earlier! The manager on duty wasn't any help either. While I was waiting in vain to be assisted at the empty bar - yes, I was the only one there at the time - she didn't even say hi or even ask if I needed anything. When I asked her point-blank if anyone was bartending, she just replied: "Oh, I'll go get him" (meaning the bartender) - and she too disappeared. Oh, hell-to-the-no! ZAP - one star gone. The bartender - Felipe, if my receipt is correct - needed some help in a big way. When I asked him which beers were on tap, he just pointed to the wall. Oh, uh, OK - I'll take THAT one. Felipe may pour some great drinks, but being "customer focused" is not his strong point. I think it's a symptom of a bigger issue. The rest of the waitstaff was more interested in watching ESPN than serving their customers. While the manager on duty was busy cleaning and busing tables, the staff was watching TV. If anything else, I was going to "pic-shame" them and post it on Yelp. I was about to snap a picture on the down-low but I think they noticed that I was aiming in their direction and they scattered like cockroaches. ZAP - second star gone. Of course, Felipe was busy chatting with his regulars than to ask if I wanted a second beer, pour me some extra water or deliver more napkins without being told by me. If he had been attentive, I would have given him some extra padding for his tip. Nope - I had to ask for everything. ZAP - third star gone. Good thing I'm a Plenti member, since I got at least something for my troubles. But if I'm going to go to a Chili's in the future, it will be the one on 290 - with a nicer manager and sharp bartender - or the one on the Southwest Freeway, which also has great service and a very attentive lunchtime bartender. But I digress. Bottom line: I sure as heck won't be coming back here, unless serious changes to customer attention are made.   Personally, I think that GM David Hulsey needs to have a conference with his front-of-the-house help. IMMEDIATELY. All of these low-star reviews are valid, in my opinion.

Upon seating us they told us our waiter's name. We waited about 10 mins before meeting him. A host finally came to take our drink orders and delivered them to us. We still hadn't met the waiter. Our drinks were never refilled the whole meal. Our appetizer was served with our meal. Fried pickles were lightly breaded and quite good, my prime rib mex bowl was heavy on the onions and the meat looked like it was meant for a stew. I would not recommend or re-order. My boyfriend got the salmon and he didn't voice any complaints or praise. I'm writing the review as we wait to ask for the check. Our waiter must be overworked because we only saw him the one time he took our order (for everything at once since it had taken him so long to arrive). Someone else had dropped off our food and we literally haven't seen him since. He hasn't checked in or cleared any plates. These chains should really invest in the pay at the table option like our friends at Olive Garden so when we don't see the waiter to ask for the check we can at least pay and leave on time. We asked for the check twice and the first time he said "ok" the second time he said "I got you guys." Sorry but no. You obviously don't got us.  Really poor service tonight. I won't be back.

I love that Chilli's has these Kiosks to re order. This particular location was great because it wasn't packed and the Bartender who also to my order was very attentive to me as well as the family behind me who took forever to order and has lots of request. I had the lunch double burger and salad and fries and it was good, fresh and so glad my salad wasn't all brown and old  like other locations I visited (Hwy 6).  I work around the corner and felt really stupid I didn't realize it was there all this time. Lol

Total waste of time coming to this location.  I would stop there but sadly there's so much more to say. We stopped here yesterday (04/28/16) after running errands in the area. It was our first visit to this location and we should have known better judging from the lack of cars in the parking lot during the time that you would figure a restaurant to be busiest.  First off, when we walked in, we saw that hardly any customers were there and there was no one in sight at the hostess stand, except a cleaning bucket and spray on the stand. (o......k) Finally a guy, who turned out to be our waiter came to have us seated. He said we could choose wherever we wanted but then when we chose a booth by the window he said "Oh no, that section is closed." So we just picked another table and sat down. He brought us our waters and then my bf asked him for a beer on draft (that was listed as a draft beer on the menu) and the waiter said that they didn't have it. Ok. So we asked which beers DID THEY ACTUALLY HAVE on draft and he said he would check after he put in our meal order annnnnnnnnnd he never came back.  I ordered the Pasilla Chicken off of their "Lighter Choices" menu with steamed broccoli and their warm quinoa wheat berry blend, and my bf ordered the 10oz Classic Sirloin. Once we got our food, our waiter puts my plate in front of me and tells me "Oh we didn't have the quinoa so I just brought you rice, is that ok?" Um no, it's not. When restaurants run out of something, it's not a big deal to me since normally I find something else to substitute, but the waiter usually will let you know in advance what they ran out of and they will let you choose something else. Don't just assume what you think I will want. That rubbed me the wrong way.  I told him that I didn't want the rice and I politely asked for a house salad. At least my bf's order was correct and they brought him everything that he wanted. The whole dining experience was just off. Our waiter would take his time to come check on us but he found time to SIT DOWN next to another table and chat with the people eating at another booth. I noticed that there seemed to be quite a few employees standing around and joking with one another rather than working or checking on the other patrons, given, there were not many people in the restaurant but now I see why.  After reading other people's experience at this location, I REGRET not checking yelp before coming here. We should have known better but now at least we know. First and last time here.

We went on Thursday night for $5 margaritas. The service was okay just a few issues. I did have several issues with my margarita(they were out of what I originally ordered then brought the wrong flavor). My salad was pretty good. We got dessert and it was kinda mediocre.  I've also ordered carry out several times and had a few issues. One time they completed forgot my sides and were kinda rude when I brought it up. So always check your food before leaving!

Hostess didn't greet us at the door, 20 minute wait for our drink order to be taken. Bartender had 4 people at the bar and couldn't take our drink order. Finally the bartender headed in our direction and helped every table around before she got to us. My wife was gone and she asked if I wanted to wait to order till she got back. I said yes and at the very moment my wife sat at the table and she still walked away. 15 minutes later she comes back to take my order. Very unprofessional.  I hate to not tip but this service does not deserve one. And the manager pass my table 4 time and we didn't even have a drink.

This is the worst Chili location I have been to. Not because of the food, since this is pretty much chili corporate standard.  However, they strongly lack in customer service.  We walked in and waited for a hostess to appear.  Meanwhile, several employees from the bar area kept on with their personal conversations and never said anything.  So we walked over to the bar area and asked is anyone going to seat us?  The hostess was among them conversating  and rudely said someone will be there shortly.  Shortly as in when she wraps up the conversation.  After we were finally seated we ordered the usual stuff that Chilli has to offer.  But the beginning totally soured my mood.  The food is standard but the employees attitudes are substandard.
I placed a to go order online. I did not get fries with one of the orders and when I called no one answered. Called several times to speak to manager and no answer

Wife, daughter and I visited on Sunday, June 4, 2017.  We had issues.   I gave three stars, as opposed to one star, for the following reasons: 1. In the past, we have had consistently great service and fair to good wait timing. 2. The wait staff bust their ass every time we go there, including this time.  However, this should not negate the poor service reviews provided by others.  We have had cool tattooed waiter and waitress staff that really worked hard and provided great service in the past.   The waitress on this day was awesome and perfect.  She knew the specials and could recite them correctly spot on from memory.   She was prompt with no dilly dally. 3. We like the place.  And again, we had an awesome waitress. Now, the ding in stars (only 3 stars) is because we had issues.  We went here because my wife had a craving and we had a coupon for a free kids menu.   The hostess said that we could only have a high chair at a table with chairs, not a booth table.  The hostess said the issue had to do with the height of the booth table tops.  My wife and I said we want a booth, let's try the high chair with the booth.  We had to talk real sweet and patiently to try to convince the hostess to let us have a high chair at a booth.   This was our first compromise in staying and not leaving.  This was a little uncomfortable, because we have eaten a lot of times at Chili's over the past year, and we have not run across this issue before.  Chili's had not changed out their tables recently, and the booth tables were at the same exact height as the tables with the individual chairs.   Maybe we entered into the Twilight Zone, becasue the interaction was weird. So we ordered a kids meal and two adult entrees.   The waitress brings the drinks promptly.  Short time later the pineapple (side) for our daughter's kids meal arrives with the rest of her meal.  However, the bowl with teh pineapple looked a little dirty and there are a couple of chopped peepers on the pineapple.  So we dismiss it (unfortunately) and satyed.  This was our second compromise. I had a salad with my meal.  I asked for no cucumber and the dressing on the side.  The salad arrived shortly after our daughter's kids meal.  When I poured the dressing on the salad, there were large chunks of cucumber at the bottom of the dressing container (cup).  I thought someone in the kitchen is messing with us.  I started to pick the cucumber out (start of third compromise), but I said to my wife, "no, that's it. I am not letting the rest of the meal go on like this.  What ele is next?  We are leaving."  I had the same salad dressing before, and it did not have the cucumber in it, nor does the dressing recipe call for large chunks of cucumber. We only received drinks, the kids meal side of pineapple, the kids meal, and the unacceptable salad.   Although my wife cut up the kids meals into small pieces for our daughter, it was not eaten.  Only one to three pineapple pieces were eaten. I got up and politely asked for a manager. I waited about 5 minutes, and our server came out from the kitchen with an order of food.  I told her the problem and said we were leaving and not paying for anything.  "We had not eaten the (figurative) "steak" after the issues arose" as Judge Judy would say.   My wife wanted to make sure the manager heard why were leaving, so we waited another 5 minutes.  The hostess advised that the manager was not available to come talk to us, because she was on the phone with the police regarding a problem / incident with another customer.  So we finally left. The thing was that the compromises were quickly adding up, and we just did not want to have any more uncomfortable things come up over the course of the meal related to the food prep and our experience.   We wanted to avoid having to continue to compromise and just let additional worse stuff go if it continued to occur.   We were really hoping the manager or the wait staff would get together and tweak out these things and maybe get onto the kitchen staff to stop the poor food prep.  What if I were allergic to cucumbers?  Would it be OK?  It was not this extremely serious for us, because I did not eat any of the salad, nor do I have that allergy.   We were not told what the problem was that had to do with the phone call to the police, but my wife and I joked about what that "incident" could have possibly been, in private after leaving Chili's.  Had Chili's done something similar with another customer's food that just pissed him/her off?   Who knows.   We needed the laugh after our experience.  We do not regularly pick up and leave from a restaurant due to problems.

I used to love going to Chili's but somehow every time I go I am left disappointed. My order was wrong on the first go round. I would rather pay more money and go somewhere nicer. You get what you pay for sometimes.

Overall a good food selection and visit. I was seated immediately. My server, April, was very friendly. The order taken and served accurately and timely. The beef enchilada was spot on TexMex. Soup was a bit thick but tasty. The tostada was soggy so I would sub with a chicken enchilada next time.  The margarita was heavenly! The tostada would have deducted a star but I mentioned the soggyness to my server and she apparently informed the manager who visited my table to see if I wanted another one. I declined but appreciated the offer so they keep the star for great responsiveness. I'd definitely recommend this location for good food, fast friendly service, laidback atmosphere, and adult libations, of course!

this place sucks service none existent , where did they find these so called wokers ? first they take for ever jus to come to the table , forever again to bring the drinks. finally they get the order , take forever with bugers and fries ? this place needs help ! seen another server come take an order from table next us , went to table sat down while taking order ! wow some service , lazy and rude snobby typical minimum wage earners......  thanks but no thanks ! modus operandi

Received a super tiny burrito when I picked up an order to go. It was mostly just a tortilla with very little ingredients inside. Girl at takeout desk showed it a manager and she said yeah, it's a little small. Manager's solution was to bring me a slightly bigger burrito. I'm posting a picture of three burritos. The one advertised, the first mini-rito and then his slightly older brother. But the people were nice, so two stars for that.

This is the closest Chili's to my place. My parents love it so every time they come into town we eat here. The place is no different than any other franchise establishments.  The service is really good though. They are always friendly and super accommodating to my mom's crazy requests. I always ask for extra buffalo sauce for my wings and corn tortillas and they happily comply.
This location is CLUELESS!!! Seriously. Do not go to this restaurant. If they have a manager, which I can't imagine, he/she should be horse whipped and urinated on.

Friday 3/4/16 I gave this place a try for the 3rd time and once again to my disappointment the service was horrible.  Walked in and there was a waiting line so I went to sit at the bar.  After 15mins I finally got a menu.  Within my waiting time I notice so many tables that need to be cleaned and no one was doing it.  Waited another 10mins to get serviced and nothing.  I just go up and left.  I will never walk into this place again.  Service is poor and the place is just dirty.  It's sad because I love Chili's just have to make the drive to North Freeway where I know the service is great.
Excellent service, good food, great margaritas. Had a "in the loop" feel not the typical suburbia chain restaurant Chile's. Plenty of screens for watching Texan's games.
Total crap place, very rude people. Don't want to serve people. Don't even think of coming here. Just have to give 1 star for the sake of it

As bad as the service is here, I do love their pasta. I have had it at other locations where the service was much better, but this being the closest location to me I have decided to add my review here. Like stated above the service is not all that great. Each time we have gone regardless of the server they always seem to forget something, on the order or just common curiosity items. For example they have forgotten our silverware, extra napkins, condiments, side orders etc. Plus if you need anything you always have to literally hunt them down to ask for anything.
Good classic American food with a great selection of drinks and beer. The enchilada soup is amazing
Only 1 star because 0 stars isn't an option. This place is trash. Never ever go here. Literally trash on the tables and on the floors, food tasted old, silverware had food on it. Disgusting.
I wish I could give - 5 stars. I love chilis but wow the service at this location is horrible along with the manager ! I have never in my life met a manger that horrible !

Horrible experience, I am still not over.  Saturday night 04/04/2015, my husband and I decided to visit Chilis. We were seated by a very nice gentleman who asked how our day was.   We got our menus and waited... and waited... The place was not busy but I know they always seem short handed.  2 Caucasian women were seated in the booth behind us. Seconds later, the waitress goes and helps them.  I figured okay, she didn't see us, she will now take our drink  order, I was wrong! She didn't even look our way and walked passed us.  My husband and I walked out and plan on NEVER EVER EVER visiting this place again. I am also going to post this on my social media pages, that way people like don't spend their hard earned money where is not deserved.

In an attempt to eat somewhere that we haven't eaten in a long time, we chose Chili's on Katy Freeway next to Target. We arrived at lunch and received immediate seating, which was a surprise. I thought it would be packed on a Friday at noon, but surprisingly it wasn't. We got immediate service for drinks.  We had the lunch special, which has a soup/salad and a sandwich with fries (a few other options also) for about $8. That is a great lunch deal and the portions were the perfect size. I would have given this location a higher rating, but there were a few things that irked me: 1. The server was no that great - he was horrible, but he was obviously not very 'into' his job. 2. He would often walk by our table with a free hand and leave dirty dishes on the table - even though they were clearly moved to the side and ready to be removed. This happened about 5 times - so many times that we started to count. 3. We gave him the credit card to take care of the check. He then with his one free hand took food to other tables with our check and credit card in his hand. My thought that it was a perfect way to lose someone's credit card. 4. He seemed sluggish and not very quick - not the personality that I think Chili's is trying to promote. I don't know if it is a training issue for him or a job fit issue, but he could use some more training.  So the food was okay, the service was less than average, but just above being rated horrible. If we had a better service experience, I would have given another star. We would go back, but not with that server.

The service was really really awful, mostly because they were drastically understaffed. We sat at the bar and I saw the bartender take a dirty beer mug, rinse it out with water and give it to a waiter to serve beer.

food was good had to wait it was pretty bad but our server that took over made up for it.  cant expect much after all its chilis. and manager if you read yelp... dont scream at ur employees from the kitchen ur guests can hear u.

I visited this restaurant today with my co-worker. The food was ok. My issue was the server. He never gave us utensils with the napkins wrapped on them. I had to go find some myself. Then when my coworker asked for more chips because the ones she got were slightly overcooked, he replaced them with more overcooked chips. She had to ask for a refund for the chips/salsa. Then when I got my food, I asked for mayonnaise and ranch. He never brought them to me. He pretty much ignored our table. Then I ordered a cheesecake to go. We paid for everything and sat there for a good 10-15 minutes longer, waiting for the cheesecake. I had to ASK him for the cheesecake. Our lunch hour turned into almost 2 hours and this location is probably about 10 minutes from our office. I will not eat there again.

I don't expect a lot from the food from Chili's - I do expect the food to to be hot and timely.  The service is usually good.  We waited for 50 minutes. For cold baked potato soup.  Server was was fine, John the manager was okay, but became rude after talking to us.  Bad cold food, bad management, will not be back.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!! We haven't been to Chili's in years...after last night I remembered why. We had the worst possible service and quality of food ever. We walked in on a Monday night at 8pm. The restaurant was fairly empty....yet it was at least 5 min before the hostess came by to seat us. We wanted to sit in the bar area but all of the tables were dirty. She offered to clean one for us so we waited for her to clean one. It was another 5 min before she came back with a towel to clean the table. We finally sat down and quickly started looking at the menus. Another 5 min went by before anyone came by to take our drink order. He dropped off water and one of the drinks but doesn't take our food order. After another 5 min he finally comes back to take our order. We ordered fried pickles as an app, a burger and chicken crispers. 15 min go by and the pickles finally come out....soggy, greasy, and disgusting. He didn't back to check on the apps so we sat there for another 10 min with empty drinks, soggy pickles, and hunger pains. Our food came out before we were able to send back the pickles. We told him about pickles and he just said "okay" and walked away. He didn't offer to bring out another batch, or offer another option, or a credit.the bill. I was hoping the meal with be better than the app, but  that wasn't the case. The chicken was barely cooked, raw in some parts and felt slimey to the touch. The breading was soggy. The honey mustard sauce was watered down. The burger was overcooked. All of the food turned out so bad that i couldn't finish my meal and didn't want to bother with getting something else. After seeing the raw slimy chicken we lost our appetite. I don't see how this place is still in business. We will never go back.

Typical chills food. Very bad service. Had to ask for refills. Food took a long time to come out and they were hardly busy even at lunch. Don't waste your time at this place unless you have all day to eat and burn time.

My godfather wanted to come here because he was craving baby back ribs.  Of all the places to eat in Houston that aren't a chain and he chooses here!   Oh well it wasn't that bad but wasn't anything great either.  The waitress was very pushy and kept trying to get us to order apps and a desert even though we told her we didn't want to.  Also I think Chili's has just gone down hill in the last few years unfortunately.  I got the shrimp tacos and they were ok but when I found out the calories I was shocked.  My husband got the chicken quesadillas and they were pretty good.  Definitely won't be back here and wouldn't recommend it considering all the other restaurants are in Houston!

I ordered a double cheese burger with french fries to go from this place and apparently the fries come seperate where you have to advise them to add it to your order. The hamburger was okay but a bit dry. The hamburger had all the condiments available (mustard/mayo) except ketchup. So it tased dry. There was no ketchup packets added in my bag. But what really made me give a really low rating is that I was really looking forward to eating the fries but i bit into one of them and it had this awful hard, sewer taste and smell which really killed my appetite. Definitely not going back here again.

I usually love chili's. I am a former Chilihead so they will always have a piece of my heart. This visit was absolutely ridiculous. My girlfriend and I stopped by after I worked a grueling 12 hour shift. All I wanted was a beer and some crispers. We sat at the bar top. The bar was not busy at all. The bartender only had two other guest at the bar top. So I was very surprised at his behavior. I can't remember the guy's name but it does start with a B. Barney, Barry, Bart something like that. Anyway. His attitude was complete S#%T. He wasn't welcoming at all. He didn't greet us, he just threw menus and silver in front of us. He seemed to be more concerned with watching the basketball game. My girlfriend and I are both servers and we're still in our uniforms. You would think that would at least make the guy work on his tip since servers in general tend to over tip. I finally had enough of his stinky ass attitude. I paid for my beer and left. I didn't get the crispers I had been thinking about all day. Thanks a lot Jackass!

Visited this location for a happy hour bday celebration, 1 server for the entire bar area made it very hard to get additional drinks we were not allowed to order any drinks directly from the bar which did not have any guest. The waiter was trying his hardest but you could tell he was very stressed. At the end when it came time to pay 1 of my guest card was declined and instead of telling her quietly he pretty much told the entire bar area very embarrassing for her. Also we were told to quiet down which I would understand if we were in the dinning area but we were not we were in the bar area which I feel should be expected to be a little louder. Will not be returning.

It's amazing how accurate the rating system has proved to be. Parking in the Heights is horrible right now & I came here for a beer while I watch the Rockets playoff game. Right when I walk in I tell the hostess I want to watch the game in the bar area & she states there are no seats at the bar. Then ask me if I would like a booth on the other side. I asked her if there were any seats in the bar area at a table & she then said yes.  Once seated, I watch a guy behind me get seated at a table top & have a waitress address him. Once the waitress did come my way she ask if I need anything & I say yes, a menu & a drink menu. She points to the rack of menus which I over looked. A staff member (sweeping the floor) addressed me & tells me about the happy hour options for drinks/food. I ask her if she's the waiting staff for my table as I assume this is a conversation my waiter would have had but no. The lady who came prior & pointed at the rack of menus was my server it turns out.  At this point I notice there are SEVERAL empty seats at the bar. I approach & ask the other customers if these seats are taken & they say no.  The area hasn't been cleaned because there may have been some people who just left. No big deal, once the bar tender comes over I'm sure he'll address that.  NOPE. He grabs all the menus, including the one I brought with me. Takes the half full beer mug. Ask the guy next to me if someone was still sitting there (the seat next to me) & turns away. Ok, cool smh. A few seconds go by, maybe 30 & a trip or two past me by the bar tender. I go back to my car because I have water there & can just bring it inside. When I come back it's amazing, the area has been cleaned & menus removed. I guess he assumed I was leaving. I thought about it but no, I want to see this game.  Long story short, piss poor service & not welcoming staff (except the lady who was sweeping the floors). One star for sure.

This Chili's was sort of depressing. The food was good, but the service and atmosphere were lacking.  The tables and floor seemed dirty and the napkins that were placed on our table had brown spots all over them. Our food took an extremely long time to come out. I think the server may have forgotten to put our order in because when it finally came out she apologized and had a manager come out with her. We didn't complain, but it was kind of annoying.  They have tablets at the tables now so that you can play games (you have to pay) and pay for your meal with your credit card at your table, but all I could think about was how covered in germs they must have been. Also, ours didn't work when we tried to pay with it. We mainly ate here because we had a gift card. I like the food, but much prefer other dining out experiences.

Dine in is fine, probably the average chili's worth 3.5 stars. But DO NOT ORDER TO GO. Placed an order at 7:30, pick up time was at 8:00, got there at 8 and didn't get my food until 8:30. Waiting 30 minutes to pick up food is absolutely unacceptable. If it was going to take an hour, should have told me pick up was at 8:30. I was watching them painfully struggle with multitasking. Would have been better off dining in.

I only have one thing to comment on...... IF YOU A WAITRESS & YOU ARE ON THE FLOOR ..... put ur damn hair up... smh if it mid neck length that fine, but all down ur back and in the front almost below ur chest " come on now" . I hope you holding my plate in the air so it's not guaranteed all you can eat hair day. If I was to be the Heath inspector y'all would be fucked!
The server was wonderful and a great smile! I had the Taco Trio with Shrimp, fish and prime rib. It was good and seriously not much more overall for the entire meal than going to Taco Hell!
Waited more than 30 minutes for foods. The foods weren't good either they tasted microwaved. The dessert was the only good thing in our meal.

4 friends of mine went last night to this location..started off well BUT don't be fooled!!!!! We waited almost an hour for our food, the waiter sucked. And on top of that we had diarrhea all night and this morning. Fuck y'all. Never going back

This place is horrid by every possible measure, bad service, dirty, sketchy area, deserted, etc. Even the food is bad -- how is that even possible at chilis? If you like undercooked, nearly raw, chicken fingers this is your spot.

Because zero stars wasn't an option. Fried pickles had NO breading on them at all, enchilada soup was so thick and salty it was gross. Waited 45 min for food to come out. Food was cold and flavorless. Waiter was constantly disappearing for Ling lengths I'd time. He was very much aware of how long we had been waiting. No manager. No apologies.. ...just "hey its Sunday night. ". So here is the manager, while his restaurant is going to hell in a hand cart....watching a football game.. .clearly his priorities are not in order

I hope this place isn't as dirty as it looks. The restroom was DISGUSTING.....worse than most gas stations. Groups of employees sitting around chatting. The food was ok, but while we were eating our neighbor at the bar was served a hamburger with NO MEAT. Seriously, no lie. Chili's need's to fire the entire staff of this location and start over.

I thought 2 stars was enough, the only reason I ate here was because there were some gift cards with an award I won and we were right next to one that day. I had the unlimited enchiladas which were okay, nothing to write home about. I tried all 3 kinds but the best were the chicken with the sour cream sauce.

It's ok...I was being kind of nostalgic in my choice this evening...I really miss the days of the old West Gray location when they had fewer Restaurants.  The menu was smaller and the quality was much higher.   Getting bigger isn't always better!

Came here for some late night food after a great astros home opener, my wife and i sat at the bar as usual, just to be greeted by an extremely rude bartender. We understood they closed in 45 minutes, so we knew what we were going to get by the time we walked in the door. We got our food within 5 minutes or so, as we were eating other people walked in within 30 min of closing time, the bar tender proceeded to make rude comments about the people walking in, even said "i should of just locked these doors", i usually dont write bad reviews about places, but last night was the first time i felt the need to let other people know these people dont care about customer service.

This place was virtually empty with plenty of employees. No one seated us, it took a long time to be waited on, and we waited around 45 minutes for two meals. All of this happened while specific tables were being attended to. I have never written a negative review before but the employees that I saw had almost zero customer service skills. They mainly just hung out.

Lack of customer service. They went to the farm to get the chicken breast and beef. It took for ever since they got eggs and by the time my plate was served it turned into a chicken. Will never be here.

My friend and went to This location for dinner last night and it was such a disappointment. The Server we had was rude and eventually we changed servers because he made my friend and I feel very disrespected. The Manager worked with us and checked up on us which was a plus. I will probably not be returning to this location because of my experience. I hope no one else gets disrespected by the same server the way we did.
1st brought me the wrong cup of soup. 2nd Ordered the smoked wings some appeared to be uncooked.  Wings were still white.

Place was what you expect from a Chili's restaurant. The wait at the door was pretty bad, people were waiting around for the hostess to show. Food was hot, beer was cold. Bartender was pretty busy but still managed to provide good service.

I used Uber Eats to get me a steak today from Chilis Sawyer Heights.  Uber Eats was great. Chills was NOT.  I could not even cut the steak it was so tough.  Hope Uber Eats quits using them.  The worst meal I ever had delivered.  The only thing great about this was Uber.

This would get a 3 star rating for being a standard chain restaurant, but my cheesecake was warm when I got it. Warm cheesecake? Who wants to eat that? We went on a Friday night, and sat in the bar area. It took a while for our waitress to come and take our order, but you can't really expect more if you're sitting in the bar. I ordered a frozen strawberry margarita (yum) and it was only $5. You could taste the Cuervo they used, and my logic when it comes to margaritas is if you can't taste the tequila, you're not getting your money's worth.  Would I come back? Well, it's a Chili's. I might not come to this specific one, but I'll probably be back in my lifetime.

Daughter's volleyball team when there today befor leaving for state volleyball tournament. Talked to the manager yesterday about party of about 30.15 players and coaches then the rest parents, manager said no problem would bring in extra staff, told them would be there at 11:15 am, at 12:30 was still waiting for food. Then all but 2 parents food gets there but not players food by 12:45 players food arrives all but two players when told of this only  one waitress for all of us she didn't know where it was. Finally the asst manager brough out food but he had not been around all time we there. After all said and done the hostess literally told me we were wrong not to tip her. She nebee refilled drinks didnt bring food etc so no we did not tip. Hostess had no right to het combatibe over tip when waotress nor management did their job.

This is by far the dirtiest most unkept Chili's I have ever been to. The bar is grimy and always sticky when you sit down. Old food particles from previous diners are constantly lingering in the crevices of the edge of the bar. The bartenders are rude, standoffish, and hardly ever seen when you need them. Their uniforms are either faded or dirty... Don't even get me started on the aprons.... Eeeewwww. Why when I am the first person to sit down at lunch do I see old stains on the bartenders uniform? Why are the computer stations behind the bar which are in clear view of the guests so filthy??? Weeks of dust and old rust stains from not being wiped down properly or least of all cared for. What happened to people having pride in their jobs????? What happened to the managers??? Absolutely no sense of urgency or regard for their guests experience. This place which I have been to now 5 times and have sat at the bar every time makes me feel like I have wasted my time hoping that it would get better. Get it together. The staff of this location needs to be wiped out a made a new with a far better and more dedicated team. What a complete disappointment.

I have been here twice now and waited to write a review to see if things would get better. I walked in with my party just yesterday and our waiter was MIA, our table was messy and we were never greeted until we moved tables to an entirely different location. Everyone kept walking by. Our waiter, Clark, looked overwhelmed by the amount of people in our party (8). I was not impressed by his waiting skills. His manager was checking back more often then him, so that's how you know even they notice someone not doing well. It was not a good experience. The time before that, the girl was also in a hurry to do everything. This establishment is a joke.

On a day when you get to leave work early to attend a training, but have time to actually sit DOWN and eat, I couldn't think of what to eat! CrAzY!!!  I had a Chinese craving yesterday that I didn't think was worth the gas to get, so I figured that would be the ticket, but then part of me really wanted a burger.  So Yelping and GPSing my location found me driving to Taylor Street, which as an array of chain restaurants a rock throw from each other. After looking at reviews, I decided to partake of Chili's. Last time I went to a CBG the service was quick during the later part of the day, so I figured in a location with all these restaurants they would be up to par.  Well the wait was more than I anticipated for a philly cheese fries and potato soup. Waiting for my order cut  so close into my commute time to my next destination I almost cancelled the order.  While waiting at the counter contemplating if I should cancel,  could see that they were not only backed up on orders, but they had water backed up on the floor. Standing water coming from Idontknowwhere and don'twant2knowwhere but it didn't look very sanitary.  Just imagine having to work in a busy, narrow, and hot kitchen with water on the floor.  That's a safety hazard if I've even seen one! Plus the food was not that great. The fries right out the fryer tasted decent because I was hungry; the philly was too cheesy rather than meaty, and the potato soup- Well, let's just say La Madeline has spoiled me because this potato soup tasted more like instant potatoes with chunks of REAL potato (maybe) mixed in for texture. Even though I asked the employee behind the register about the soups and he suggested this one, I think I'd stick with the chili because it was fantastic the last time I went to CGB. Also, I need to drink some Sprite and go to the little girls room after eating the soup, so yeah PASS ON THE POTATO SOUP!!!! After this review, I do believe I'll go ahead and do the restaurant review because standing water in a restaurant is a no no.
Still waiting. That is what this whole attempt at eating here has been. No hostess. No busers. No hustle. I didnt want to be here in the first place.
Solely based on service. Waitress never checked on us very often and trying to get drinks or water was ridiculous! Food was fine, just service was not up to par tonight. And we sat in the bar area.

I have been to this location on several occasions and while the staff is usually slower than preferred my experience this visit took the cake, so to speak. Our server was extremely slow, took several minutes to even get our drinks, tea and coke... I ordered the Margarita Bowl, which I've had at other locations, and the bowl came out hot, my lettuce and Pico was starting to wilt. After dropping our food the waiter NEVER came back. Thank goodness for the hostess who passed by and obliged my request for drink refills, and for the self pay feature because who knows how long we would of waited to get a check.
Very slow service,food was decent.coming here again reminds me why I dont eat here more often.subpar for my taste.

The service here sucks just be aware that if you have been here before and know how the food should actually look, a server will correct you and give you attitude if you try to tell them Otherwise and also when they walk away they will mumble about you as if you can't hear them. Terrible service.

I've ordered from the to-go menu at this location three times and all three times they have never failed to forget at least one item from my order .. There never apologize, they never offer a discount or even a drink of water while I'm waiting, and they are just really rude about the whole thing. I really hope something can be done about the level or service here!
Daughter said the burger was good and my grandson had the kid's meal chicken tenders and they were huge and a lot of fries too. I had the eggrolls always good.
I recently started getting the quesadilla salad, one of my favorites to eat right now. If you want a Filling and delicious salad. I highly recommend it.

Ok admittidly Im not a big fan of Chilis. This one is close to the house and we wanted something quick and casual...didnt want any fast food by any means. We relunctantly decided to go to Chilis over by the Target on Taylor and I10. we were pleasantly surprised...the staff was professional and helpful. We never needed to try and find our waitress to fill our tea glasses or remove the dirty dishes. Even the hostess as well as the manager both came by and ask how wwe were doing. We ordered off the Two for $20.00 menu. In fact both entrees that we both wanted were part of the choices along with several appiteasers.  All together is was a very nice casual, fast dining experience for us.

This place is hypertension town.  Their food is so salty.  What pissed me off is the manager who came to tell me that I just need to order it right.  Ummmm wrong.  I order the same dish at Chilis in Pearland and I never have a problem.  I made them make it again and it was still salty.  Everyone at my table complained that the food was too salty.  Maybe...just maybe..it's the cook.
People that work here like to yell at each other in the door-less kitchen. Great people watching

I come here often, and usually It can be a hit and miss with the waiter's service. This last time I had an amazing Waitress and she was very attentive. The food came out hot and delicious. And It wasn't super expensive to just have a nice sit down meal.

Not a bad place. Tablets on table to distract kids and teenagers and you can also pay (credit/debit only) straight from the tablet. I love technology. Our waiter was friendly and the environment was nice.

Rack of ribs overcooked and long dried out in the oven with sauce mopped on and cold as ...  place is just dirty and waiter showed up to take order for drinks and then food.  Luckily this day we were there just to hang out and food was secondary because the food really was secondary to Chilli's as well.  Server said they were understaffed cause a lot of staff had quit.  No one goy sick from it but in the middle of the day a hundred and fifty dollar table that tips well on a Sunday afternoon mid afternoon should be cleaner and feel more attention.  The game thing did it's job for one child but what if we had several because when we went to pay cash it was confused by our switching tables /booth with it.  Maybe the games could have occasional spots for player to have to interact with others which did happen but not because of game.  Game also activated by child without permission but like I say we were just hanging out and Chili's was just there and did not impress.

I consider myself allergic to chain restaurants, however my Mum wanted something "American" for lunch on a Sunday and we were at the nearby Target, so I decided to give Chili's a try. The service was very good, the restaurant was clean and well maintained and the prices were very reasonable. BUT, it was really tricky to find something healthy, low fat, etc. Really difficult.

Ok, ok.  So I went to a Chili's and it's 2008.  Whatever.  Think of it as reliving high school.  This new place has a very convenient location if you need a quick place to meet. So, I met my mom there the other night and we had a quick bite.  Everything looked real nice and new - as it should since it's been open about a whole week now.  Apparently they were expecting LOTS of people because they had the a/c set to igloo.  They might want to also consider retraining the cooks.  We both ordered burgers cooked the same and one was seriously pink and the other was not even slightly pink.  So, i say skip this place for burgers and go to Dry Creek.  The menu is a novel so I am sure that you can find something that makes you salivate.  AND, for all you vegetarians, there are several things on the menu for you! We had so much service that it was a little weird.  I am sure that will go away within the next month.  As will the very clean look of the place. The bar is big and it's got several screens all turned on to sports.  I think they require that as standard operating procedure. Overall, it's ok.  I'm not sure that I will make a point to go there often but it sure is convenient.
Dine-in is ok as far as food and service but ordering to-go is usually either cold food or I'm sitting there waiting 20 min for my food to be cooked and everything has different temperatures.
Food was fair.Ordered the Chicken Tortilla soup when it arrived it was lukewarm, the fries weren't crispy but they were edible. Have been to other locations that were much better. Service was good.
